newsitem.title: FRANCE: French July-Aug industrial output rose vs June.
newsitem.headline: French July-Aug industrial output rose vs June.

text.p: National statistics institute INSEE said on Tuesday industrial production, excluding construction, rose 1.9 percent in July/August from June and was unchanged year-on-year. Industrial production excluding energy, agri-food businesses and construction -- considered by INSEE the best measure of manufacturing output -- rose 2.9 percent in July/August from June, giving a year-on-year fall of 0.3 percent.
It gave the following seasonally adjusted data based on a new index introduced in January 1996.
The previous index used a base year of 1985.
INSEE gave the following seasonally adjusted percentage changes:
JulAugvs Jun Jun vs May yr/yr*

NOTE - Comparison with year-ago period is for three months to end Aug versus the three months in the same period last year. INSEE said on July 23 that industrial output in June excluding construction fell 0.2 percent from May while manufacturing output rose 0.5 percent.
